skill.name: skill-writer
skill.description: Guide users through creating Agent Skills for Claude Code. Use when the user wants to create, write, author, or design a new Skill, or needs help with SKILL.md files, frontmatter, or skill structure.
skill.summary: Guide users through creating Agent Skills for Claude Code. Use when the user wants to create, write,...
skill.author: Dami-Randle

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guide text. No executable code, no file system access beyond own file, no network calls, no environment variable access. Contains only instructional content for creating Claude Code Skills.

content.value_statement: Users struggle to create reusable Agent Skills that follow best practices and validation requirements. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for designing, structuring, and validating Claude Code Skills with proper YAML frontmatter and file organization.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through creating Agent Skills with step-by-step instructions
Write proper YAML frontmatter with name, description, and allowed-tools fields
Design skill file structure including SKILL.md, reference.md, and examples.md
Validate skills against Claude Code best practices and requirements
Debug skill activation issues and description trigger words
Convert existing workflows or prompts into reusable Skills
limitations: Does not execute shell commands or create files automatically
Does not install dependencies or configure environment variables
Does not validate external tool availability or permissions
Provides guidance only; user must implement created Skills manually

best_practices: Keep each Skill focused on one specific capability rather than combining multiple unrelated functions.
Include concrete trigger words and file types in descriptions so Claude can accurately activate the Skill.
Test Skills with real user queries and iterate on descriptions to improve activation accuracy.
anti_patterns: Creating mega-Skills that try to do everything instead of focused single-purpose tools.
Using vague descriptions without specific trigger words, file types, or use cases.
Skipping validation of YAML syntax or failing to test Skill activation before publishing.

faq.question: What tools can Claude Code Skills access?
faq.answer: Skills can access any tools available to Claude Code. Use allowed-tools in frontmatter to restrict access for read-only or security-sensitive workflows.

faq.question: What is the maximum name length for a Skill?
faq.answer: Skill names must be 64 characters maximum, using only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. The name must match the directory name exactly.

faq.question: Can Skills execute shell commands?
faq.answer: Yes, Skills can guide users to execute shell commands. The skill-writer provides examples but does not execute commands itself.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using Skills?
faq.answer: This skill only reads its own documentation file. It does not access files, network, or environment variables. Each skill defines its own permissions.

faq.question: Why is my Skill not activating?
faq.answer: Common causes include vague descriptions, missing trigger words, or incorrect file locations. Add specific phrases users would say and verify the SKILL.md is in the correct path.

faq.question: How does this compare to Claude prompt files?
faq.answer: Skills are more structured than simple prompts. They include YAML metadata, file organization, optional supporting files, and are validated against best practices.
